title: Analyzing the Correlation Between Tourism Innovation and Performance: Application of Quantitative Research Methodology

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary statistical analysis and basic awareness of the tourism industry structure
context.additional_context: Learners are professionals requiring case-based education aligned with job applicability; course materials optimized for mobile devices (no PC access).

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of process and service innovation in tourism on non-financial/financial performance using PLS-SEM models
Learners can quantify the mediating effect of organizational learning to interpret innovation-performance relationships
Learners can design and execute data collection and analysis processes even in constrained environments (smartphone-centric)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
